# Major Scale in B (Mode: Dorian, Shape: C)

## Brief Presentation
The Major Scale in B is a seven-note scale with the following notes: B - C# - D - E - F# - G# - A. When played in the Dorian mode and utilizing the C shape position on the guitar, it creates a specific tonal quality. The Dorian mode gives the scale a minor feel with a major sixth, distinguishing it from the natural minor scale and contributing to its unique sound.

## Notes and Intervals
- B (Root)
- C# (Major 2nd)
- D (Major 3rd)
- E (Perfect 4th)
- F# (Perfect 5th)
- G# (Major 6th)
- A (Major 7th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Major Scale in B, when played in Dorian mode with the C shape, is often used in various genres, including Jazz, Funk, and Fusion. This scale lends a jazzy and soulful flavor to music due to its melodic nuances and the major sixth interval, providing a more upbeat and positive feel compared to natural minor scales.
